column4: I think before, I had GRUB loaded on my SATA drive (a windows OS), with an option to choose Linux (IDE drive in PCI slot). Now that I moved the IDE drive into primary master, I can't get anything to boot right. SATA's GRUB gives "Invalid partition" when trying to choose either Windows or Ubuntu
so tl;dr, how can I use the GRUB command line to choose the boot device?
